Comments_List: This class is an INCREDIBLE introduction to taking pictures with a 4x5 view camera. You'll learn how to shoot, develop, print, and edit in Photoshop. Ben is amazing and always available. Take this class!
I learned how to utilize the medium of large format photography to express and communicate artistic ideas.

Using the view camera
Making editing decisions when creating a portfolio
Scanning negatives and color correcting accordingly 
Darkroom developing of black&white and color film and darkroom printing 4x5 negatives
This class is a rigorous studio art class with regular crits. Be prepared to make new work every week.

The real strength of the course is the weekly critiques. Producing work every week forces you to put in the time and effort to begin to create a cohesive body of work you can be proud of. One aspect I would have appreciated more of was more time critiquing and talking about professional artists' work, if for no other reason than just to be exposed to more photographers.

This class is so good. It's one of the few photography classes where you actual technical knowledge as part of the curriculum. Ben is such a good teacher but more importantly he is approachable and funny and actually cares about his students and their education. If he's teaching it, 100% take it
Yes! Ben is an incredible teacher and it's clear that he really cares. I developed a ton of new skills and was excited to go to class every single week.
TAKE THIS CLASS! Large-format is a treasure and learning it with Ben is a joy.

I would recommend this course to another student with the caveat that you truly only get as much out as you put in. If you aren't willing to work hard in order to be ready for the critiques every week, then you will likely not find the class very rewarding. On the other hand, if you are, you are certain to leave at the very least with the beginnings of a project that really excites and interests you.
